definitions.definition: used for referring to a person or thing that is not near the speaker or as near to the speaker as another

examples.text: Look at that man over there.
How much are those apples at the back?

definitions.definition: used for referring to somebody/something that has already been mentioned or is already known about

examples.text: I was living with my parents at that time.
Have you forgotten about that money I lent you last week?
That dress of hers is too short.

wordOrigin: Old English thæt, nominative and accusative singular neuter of se ‘the’, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch dat and German das.
